EmailTemplate.subject: Nine Ways to Use Aircraft Downtime
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Nine Ways to Use Aircraft Downtime Downtime doesn’t mean lost time. When flight hours dip below normal, there are still things you can do to tune up your business and keep your aircraft, pilots and maintenance techs practiced and productive.
Visit our webpage, Nine Ways to Use Aircraft Downtime <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/learn/about-us/blogs/2020/04/time-well-spent-aircraft-downtime?utm_source=email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=20_americas_bga_disruption]]>, for a checklist of great ideas from Honeywell and BendixKing experts. You’ll learn how to:
- Save money by avoiding aircraft storage pitfalls - Keep pilots sharp - Make aircraft more productive
You’ll also find links to resources that can help you be ready when flight hours pick up again.
Headwinds are part of flying. But use this time on the ground wisely, and you’ll be ready to catch the tailwinds as well.
